data.description: Our GTM Enablement team is a unique strategy, curriculum, and operations team that plays an integral part in connecting our go-to-market approach and curriculum to customer value. We’re interdisciplinary thinkers leveraging diverse business backgrounds in engineering, education, management consulting, business operations (and more!) to define, manage and measure Datadog’s global go to market motion. We empower all of Datadog’s customer-facing teams with the right information, skills, and tools at the right time in order to maximize their ability to land, expand and drive Datadog’s next phase of growth. The Opportunity:The Senior Sales Enablement Associate will serve as our operations guru, our knowledge management wiz, and our process efficiency extraordinaire to help design our systems to ensure our rapidly growing global GTM Enablement teams work at-scale. We are looking for someone who has a passion for scaling programs, maintains organization, and is the heartbeat of our team’s logistics strategy. This role has the opportunity to grow into a sales enablement curriculum role. What You’ll Do:Design logistics & operations for new programs designed by our internal global sales enablement team. This includes: Creating enrollments, cohorts, communications, scheduling invites for net new live enablement programs Support with gathering the requirements across our GTM teams on dashboarding and tooling needsPartner with Enablement Operations to ensure a quality deliverable is designed and user tested with the end userSupport with the training, usage, scaling, and operationalization of new tools and initiatives across the GTM teamsOwn the plan and execution of Datadog’s Knowledge Management System (KMS), defining clear success criteria aligned to business and field needsPartner with cross-functional stakeholders across sales teams to conduct discovery interviews, identify knowledge gaps and pain points, and translate insights into actionable requirements for our knowledge management systemsAssist with reporting on our enablement program metrics to share out with our leadership teamIdentify and support the execution of ways we can embed AI and tooling into to make our operations and processes scale more efficientlyLeverages strategic thinking to uplevel our systems and process for our enablement programsSupport the content build and design for our specific initiative cross functional enablement programs as well as recommend content and program enhancements based on data and survey feedbackEnsure that we scale by creating and carrying out repeatable & measurable processesConsult and assist on a range of special projects and one off tasks as we scale and refine our operating model Who You Are:Have 2-4 years of experience working in learning and enablement, business operations or other equivalent operational experienceExtremely organized and have a strong attention to details, driving toward the most efficient processExperience with Knowledge Management SystemsA strategic thinker who is always looking to improve the status quoExperience with reporting and analysis in Tableau, Google Sheets, etc. Experience with Learning Management Systems, such as Docebo An excellent communicator with strong written and verbal skillsStrong sense of ownership: you have an intrinsic drive to achieve great outcomesYou’re a curious, investigative learner: you ask lots of questions to identify causesOutstanding multi-tasker, able to effectively prioritize projects and pivot where needed with a sense of urgencyAble to adapt to a fast-paced growth organizationPassion and energy for the details and for helping others get betterStrong appetite for learning and growing with the company as we scale Benefits & Growth: Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunitiesEmployee-focused best in class onboardingInternal mentor and cross-departmental buddy programFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$70,000—$95,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. Privacy and AI Guidelines:Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.Requisition ID: R17242
